content.description: A proton with a velocity of <math alttext="8.0 times 10 to the 5 power meters per second" overflow="scroll"><mn>8.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>5</mn></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>s</mtext></math> enters a region with a uniform magnetic field that is perpendicular to the proton’s initial velocity. After entering the field, the proton follows a circular path with a radius of <math alttext="0.040 meter" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mtext>0.040</mtext> <mspace width="0.2em"> </mspace> <mtext>m</mtext> </mstyle> </math>.
content.question: What is the magnitude of the magnetic field?

choices.label: <math alttext="3.3 times 10 to the negative 20 power tesla" overflow="scroll"><mn>3.3</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>20</mn></mrow></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>T</mtext></math>

<math alttext="2.1 times 10 to the negative 1 power tesla" overflow="scroll"><mn>2.1</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>T</mtext></math>
<math alttext="1.7 times 10 to the 5 power teslas" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.7</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>5</mn></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>T</mtext></math>
<math alttext="1.3 times 10 to the 26 power teslas" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.3</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>26</mn></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>T</mtext></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="2.1 times 10 to the negative 1 power tesla" overflow="scroll"><mn>2.1</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>T</mtext></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
